subject: Travel
title: Shoes Off at the Mosque
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Shoes Off at the Mosque.

hook.text: Showing the sole of your shoe to someone in the Middle East is a deep insult. Shoes carry spiritual dirt.

buildup.text: Mosques require all visitors to remove shoes before entering. Shelves at the door hold hundreds of pairs.

discovery.text: The tradition comes from the Quran. Moses was told to remove his sandals on holy ground.

twist.text: In 2008, a journalist threw his shoe at President Bush at a press conference â€” the ultimate Arab insult.

climax.text: Temples in Asia, many churches in Ethiopia, and homes in Japan share the same shoes-off rule.

punchline.text: Across cultures, respect begins at your feet.

quiz.question: Why must shoes be removed before entering a mosque?
